list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This animal stores its food in two pouches under its chin.

list_definition.mean_english: túi của một số động vật
list_definition.definition: the pocket of skin in which the young of certain kinds of animal, eg the kangaroo, are reared.

Both the golden-mantled ground squirrel and the chipmunk have cheek pouches for carrying food.
Brood pouches vary significantly among different species of pipefish, but all contain a small opening through which female eggs can be deposited.
They have elongated cheek pouches extending to their shoulders in which they carry food back to their burrows.
